result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional as the reception center. Eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program.
Concurrent with: sentence being served

Conditions:

Provide DNA sample if not previously given.

Pay costs of action and costs of supervision.

No illegal drug use or possession of paraphernalia.

Not to consume alcohol or be on the premises of any business which is primarily engaged in the sale of alcohol.

Attend, pay for and successfully complete any programming as required by DOC. 

No credit.
Concurrent with: sentence being served

ADDRESS INFO for Justin L. Hanson
Current: PO Box 445, Fall Creek, WI 54742 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2016)
Prior: E15775 Lincoln Drive, Fall Creek, WI 54742

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in custody and in court with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Christine Seidl appeared by phone means. Agent Seidl addresses questions re. PSI.  Argument by DA Harper. Rec. 16 months init confinement, 36 months ext sup to run concurrent. Argument by Atty F.  Requests court follow recommendations of probation agent, requests ERP & SAP. Comment by def. 

Sentencing:

Ct 1: 18 months init confinement, 36 months ext sup, concurrent with what he is serving now. Dodge Correctional is the reception center. Eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. Conditions of ext sup: DNA sample if not previously given, pay costs of action, costs of supervision, no illegal drug use or paraphernalia, not to consume alcohol or be on the premises of any business whose primary business is the sale of alcohol, must attend, pay for and successfully complete any programming as required by DOC. No credit. 

DA moves to dismiss 15CF21. No objection. Case dismissed.

court gives voting/firearm admonishments.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-12-2015 11:00 am  (SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION OF DPA)

Two cases called together (14CF87/sentencing after revocation of DPA & 15CF21/prelim). Defendant Justin L. Hanson in custody, in court with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

In 15CF21, DA Harper states there will be a waiver of prelim.  Prelim waiver conducted.  Information filed.   Reading waived.  Charges stated.  Bindover ordered.  Arraignment adjourned.

In 14CF87, Atty. Franker notes agent's recommendation for sentencing - "consecutive with jail sentence" and states this is different than what has been related to the def.  DA Harper states that her belief was that the agent's recommendation was that it be "concurrent."  Atty. Franker has asked that the Court reschedule this matter for clarification.  DA objects.  Court requests PSI writer's input and directs clerk to place a call to Agent K Seidl.  Agent Seidl not available.  Agent H Perrault appears by phone and states she is not familiar with the case; contacts supervisor.  Supervisor J Moessner appears by phone and is questioned by the Court re the agent's intention.  Supervisor Moessner states that the agent's intention is as it is written in the PSI.

Court adjourns 14CF87 sentencing to Friday, June 12 at 11 a.m.  PSI writer to appear in person for the hearing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-05-2015 02:45 pm  (SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION OF DPA)
rescheduling request from Atty. Franker - needs the June 5 SEHR moved to later in the afternoon; no objection from DA
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-05-2015 01:30 pm (SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION OF DPA)
request of Atty. Franker to reschedule the June 3rd hearing; approved by the Court; matter reset for June 5 at 1:30
Motion Hearing held this 12th day of March, 2015
Plea & Sentencing Hearing held this 9th Day of December 2014.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-03-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court. Attorney David William Franker in court for Defendant Justin L. Hanson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared via telephone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Franker notes he has been appointed as counsel for 15CF21 and also states def will not fight the DA's motion to revoke diversion agreement in this case. Court's colloquy re waiver. Court accepts waiver. Defense requests PSI on revocation of DPA. Court orders PSI, set for June 3 for sentencing.  Warrant quashed in this case.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Amended...and Motion.
Motion hearing at 04-10-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court, in custody, with attorney David William Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA has motion to revoked def's DPA.  Atty. F requested def be in person for this hearing today; he has been transported here from Eau Claire County as he is presently in custody there.  It has been noted that def has matters pending in other counties.  Atty. Franker has objected to proceeding today on the State's motion to revoke the DPA; states def is entitled to due process; states the def hasn't been privy to the documents that are the State's basis for revocation of the DPA.  DA Harper's position is that def's due process has not been violated; doesn't want this matter delayed further.  Court adjourns this matter to April 10th at 9:00 a.m.  DA requests that Atty. F keep DA's office informed as to which facility def is being housed in so that the DA's office can prepared the proper order for transport.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing at 03-12-2015 01:30 pm

Atty. Franker's email request to move the 3/12 motion hearing from 2:30 to 1:30; no objection from DA's office; matter moved to 1:30 with email notification back to Atty. Franker and verbal notification to DA's office and RCSD for transport purposes
Motion hearing at 03-12-2015 02:30 pm

9:15 a.m.  SL of DA's office notifies clerk that the def cannot be transported to Richland County for his 11:15 hrg today as he is no longer in LaCrosse County (was transported from LaCrosse to Eau Claire County without notification to Richland County).  Clerk contacts Atty. Franker who states that, rather than a video appearance from Eau Claire for his client, he wants him brought to Richland County on a rescheduled date.  Clerk resets the 11:15 motion hearing of 3/5/15 to Thursday, 3/12/15 at 2:30 with phone notification to Atty. Franker, with written notice to follow.
to produce
Motion hearing at 03-05-2015 11:15 am.  NOH also sent to Justin Hanson at the LaCrosse Cty Jail 333 Vine Street LaCrosse WI 54601
RCSD Disposition of Warrant or Commitment

DA Harper for the State. Def does not appear. DA notes this matter was noticed for 2/4/15 but never calendared/called. Motion to revoke DPA is before the Court today. DA Harper requests warrant. Court will authorize warrant.
Diversion Agreement

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court with attorney David W. Franker. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:
13CF85/pleas.
14CF38/pleas.
14CF61/pleas.
14CF87/adjourned initial
Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.  DA Harper details the agreement which calls for the def's plea of GNC to count 1, as a felony bail jumping, in 14CF87 for a 4-year diversion agreement.  Further, in 13CF85, State will be moving to dismiss/read in count 1/burglary and moving to amend count 2 from theft to misdemeanor bail jumping.  In 14CF38, the State will move to amend felony bail jumping to misd. bail jumping.  In 14CF61, State will move to amend count 1/felony bail jumping to misd. bail jumping and move to dismiss/read in count 2.  Per Harper, the joint recommendation for sentencing on the misd. bail jumping charges is 6 mo jail on each count, consecutive to one another, imposed/stayed for 24 months probation with AODA/treatment and costs as conditions and restitution of $810.00 to C Colson (13CF85).  46 days credit to be applied to 13CF85. 

14CF87/prelim waived, information filed, and def enters no contest plea to count 1/felony bail jumping.  Def pleads no contest to the remaining charges included in the agreement, all misd. bail jumping.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  

Finding of guilty to all plead counts.  Sentence withheld for 4 year diversion agreement in 14CF87.

Sentence in the remaining matters:
13CF85 - Count 2 - 6 mo in the county jail with work release and 46 days overall credit, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.  Count 1 DRI.
14CF38 - Count 1 - 6 mo in the county jail, consecutive to 13CF85, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.
14CF61 - Count 1 - 6 mo in the county jail, consecutive to 13CF85 and, imposed/stayed, for 24 months probation.
Conditions of probation:  AODA/follow through recommendations of the counselor.  Restitution of $810 to C Colson in 13CF85.  Any counseling/education/programming as directed by agent.  Pay costs. Count 2 DRI.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-09-2014 03:30 pm

Attorney David W. Franker appeared by phone means for Defendant Justin L. Hanson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  4 cases called together:  14CF87, 14CF38, 14CF61, 13CF85.  Atty. Franker asks that all matter be adjourned; he is not available today due to court obligations in another county.  Court adjourns all to Dec. 9 at 3:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
email re. appearance from DA
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-08-2014 10:00 am
Defendant to submit to booking at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Justin L. Hanson in court, in custody, without counsel; has Atty. Franker as defense counsel, however, Atty. Franker is unable to be here due to med. condition.  4 cases called together.  DA Harper, for the State, informs the Court that the parties had an agreement to resolve these matters; that agreement would have resulted in def's release from jail this date.  In lieu of what has occurred,  DA is asking for the following bond modifications:

14CF61 - $2500 cash bond to be amended to $2500 signature bond.  No special conditions requested.
14CF38 - there is already a signature bond - but it should be amended to delete the residence requirement - so just a 10k sig bond
13CF85 - there is already a 10k signature bond - but residence and curfew requirements are to be deleted - no contact prohibitions from original bond remain in effect
14CF87 - bond has not yet been set - State requests 10k signature bond and def needs to be printed

All matters reset for Monday, Dec. 8 at 10:00.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
